text: It's incredibly important that we pay attention to all aspects of our well-being in a stressful time like this. As we enter #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth, New Hampshire's mental health centers are here to help, and I'm working to help them get the resources they need.

As we approach the end of April, I’m asking for your help to defend the progress we’ve fought for. Our campaign is powered by grassroots donors, and we’re fighting an avalanche of money from the other side. Whatever you can give right now, it would mean the world to me.

Behind-the-scenes from my typical video conferencing setup (with plenty of books on hand). I’m grateful for the tools that allow us to stay connected so I can hear from public health experts, small business owners, first responders, and other front line workers. #WorkFromHome

More New Hampshire small businesses have been approved for loans today. While I'm pleased that we're providing more relief to get through this crisis, it is absolutely critical that we make sure this money is going to the businesses that need it most. Having a relationship with a big bank shouldn't determine whether your business can keep workers on the payroll.

My colleague Kirsten Gillibrand is right: the USPS performs an essential public good for millions of Americans, especially in rural communities that major corporations would charge a premium to serve. Hurting the Post Office hurts everyone. #SaveTheUSPS

“In a period particularly fraught with political partisanship, Sen. Shaheen proved her ability to put politics aside collaborating with Republican colleagues to pass a bill prioritizing small businesses and working families.”

The post office provides an indispensable service to every community in the country, and the 600,000 Americans it employs are on the front lines of this crisis. The next relief package must include more funding to keep it operational.

The Trump administration has so far failed to expand testing efforts in the way that we need to reopen shuttered businesses. That's why I fought for and secured more funding in this upcoming legislation to give NH the capability to expand on its own.

Yesterday I helped pass a bill with $484 billion to provide much-needed relief to New Hampshire small businesses and hospitals, and increase testing capacity across the state. Small business and health care providers need urgent help. Let's get this signed into law so these funds come to NH quickly.

Even in this pandemic, we can't forget the long-term environmental crisis of climate change. This #EarthDay I’m reminded of how connected we are to each other, and to the environment. Let’s act like it, and work together to protect our planet for the next generation. That’s why I’ve called for the U.S. to rejoin the Paris Climate Agreement, and introduced bipartisan legislation to drive down energy costs for families while lowering our carbon footprint. We owe it to future generations to take action while we still can. #EarthDay2020
I'm reaching out directly to give you an update on our response to the #COVID19 crisis.

Many New Hampshire veterans haven't needed to file tax returns, but that doesn't mean they don't need our help right now. I pushed with Senator Maggie Hassan to make sure vets will get assistance they need and earned, and am glad it's happening.  https://www.wmur.com/article/veterans-to-receive-federal-covid-19-impact-payment-without-filing-tax-returns/32191870

Happy Greek Orthodox Easter to everyone celebrating today! The traditional painted red eggs are a symbol of hope and the renewal of life. Sending you my best wishes for a fun and healthy holiday wherever you may be. Καλό Πάσχα!

I'm proud to endorse Joe Biden for President of the United States. ‪My friend Joe Biden has dedicated his life to making a difference for American families. From VAWA to the ACA, he's shown the values and persistence needed to get the job done. This is the most consequential election of my lifetime. I said from the beginning I would support our nominee and I am excited to endorse Joe. Standing together, we can build a stronger economy and brighter future for all Granite Staters.

In addition to the important role they play in New Hampshire's economy, our airports are crucial lifelines to the supplies we need to fight this pandemic. The CARES Act funding will help Manchester and other airports in New Hampshire continue to operate. https://www.unionleader.com/news/health/coronavirus/nh-airports-land-15-2m-through-cares-act/article_dd88d638-e6b7-5be0-8bf3-d1d59cf1ed0e.html

Nurses aren't just saving patients' lives: they're working together to keep each other safe, like the team at Elliot Hospital building a disposable gown they designed themselves. They deserve our support now more than ever.

More than 4,400 NH small businesses have been approved for $1 billion in forgivable loans as part of the CARES Act. Every job we save is one more paycheck for a family that needs to put food on the table. Now, SBA must move quickly to get money out ASAP.

This delivery of over 6.6 million masks and other PPE items will make an extraordinary difference for our health care providers and workers. Thank you to Dean Kamen and everyone who played a part in bringing this crucial aid to NH.

Wishing a joyful #Easter to all those celebrating in New Hampshire and around the world today. Today is a day to celebrate hope and new beginnings - even if we're apart, I hope you are able to find some of that spirit today, and keep it with you in the days ahead.
Thanks for the first picture challenge, . Here's Billy and I caught in the waves way back when... How's this for a ?  Your turn, !

In 2008, Kevin Kurland was serving abroad when he hatched an idea for a small business. Today, Kevin is serving his community back home, making hand sanitizer for Granite Staters through that business, Smoky Quartz Distillery.  Thank you, Kevin.

Today's ruling is a major victory for voting rights in New Hampshire. #SB3 placed undue burdens on registering to vote. In the midst of this pandemic it would have created unnecessary lines on Election Day.

On this first night of #Passover, my warmest wishes go out to the Jewish community, however and wherever you may be celebrating tonight. This night is different in many ways, but I hope it brings you familiar feelings of love and solidarity. Chag Sameach!

This #WorldHealthDay, let's give thanks for the doctors, nurses, and health care workers on the front lines of the #COVID19 crisis. We owe them all our deepest gratitude, and I will make sure they get the tools they need to be safe and save lives.

So many people are coming together to support each other during this time of crisis. From sewing and donating masks to dropping off essential supplies and food, Granite Staters are pitching in any way they can to help each other. If you have friends, neighbors, colleagues, anyone who is stepping up to give their time and effort to help others, share their story here.  Let's lift up the best of us and show others how they can make this time a little easier for someone in need. Please, stay safe, stay home if you can, and take care of each other. -J.S.

Our local food banks are more important than ever right now. No family should have to worry about where their next meal will come from. I fought to make sure they have federal support through the CARES Act, but donations have dropped significantly. Please consider donating if you are able.

Today is Equal Pay Day, the date that symbolizes how far into the year women must work to earn what their male counterparts earned in the previous year. That gap is greater for women of color. During times of crisis, these inequalities are exacerbated:
Last night, the Senate passed a bipartisan coronavirus response bill that will provide necessary support for NH workers, families, small businesses, hospitals & health care providers.

This is a challenging time for all of us, but I'm pleased to share some good news: We succeeded in securing the freedom of Dover resident Amer Fakhoury, who had been wrongfully detained in Lebanon since September. He returned to the U.S. last week.

I’ve been touched by efforts to bring some light to our communities across New Hampshire - literally, in this case. The holiday lights in Farmington, NH are back up. What a beautiful way to spread joy while we’re social distancing.Understanding exponential math and how it applies to the coronavirus. For those of you that don't quite know what exponential growth  really is. It is critical...
Thanks New Hampshire Public Radio for this list of ways to give back or connect with our communities while practicing safe social distancing.

As part of the next coronavirus response bill, I’m negotiating bipartisan legislation to support small businesses in NH and across the country grappling with the impact of the coronavirus. We need quick, bold action to fight for small businesses and workers.

With the coronavirus spreading, my top priority is ensuring that Granite Staters and people across the country are staying healthy. Look out for one another. Check in with family, friends, and neighbors with a call or text message. We all have a role to play in confronting this public health crisis and keeping our communities safe. We're in this together.
We're just one week away from this year's Snowflake Reception! Click here to RSVP: http://bit.ly/snowflake2020 See you there! -J.S.

Today, the Supreme Court is hearing arguments for June Medical Services v. Russo, which could determine the fate of Roe v. Wade.  I'm saying it loud and clear: I will fight to protect reproductive rights with everything I've got. #MyRightMyDecision
Next Friday, March 13, join Senator Shaheen at the season's most exciting event -- the 9th Annual Snowflake Reception! Click here for details: http://bit.ly/snowflake2020

This means millions of Americans with pre-existing conditions -- including more than 570,000 Granite Staters -- could lose their insurance. The future of high-quality, affordable health care is on the ballot this year. We must elect Democrats committed to protecting our care.
Happy birthday to a great friend and colleague, Maggie Hassan! It's an honor to serve New Hampshire alongside you.

This week's Senate votes on two anti-abortion bills were part of the GOP's full-blown attack on Roe v. Wade. The only way to stop this assault is to replace the man in the White House and take back the Senate from Mitch McConnell. Read my NBC News op-ed:
50 years of Valentine's Days with you, Billy.

New Hampshire: Polls are closing soon in today's historic first in the nation primary! Be sure to visit http://iwillvote.com to find your polling location. If you’re in line to vote when the polls close, stay in line until you’ve cast your ballot. See you at the polls! 🗳

Donald Trump just stepped off the stage at his Manchester rally. He made it clear that the GOP is targeting New Hampshire in 2020. We know Trump and his allies will spend millions to try to defeat me. We need to be ready to fight back, and we can’t do it without you. Chip in $5 and join our team:

Tomorrow is Election Day, New Hampshire! Here's a checklist:  📍 Confirm your polling location and hours at http://iwillvote.com 📝 Make your plan to vote 👪 Confirm your friends and family have plans to vote 🗳️ Go to the polls!

Donald Trump is coming to New Hampshire for a rally TODAY. He lost NH by half a percentage point in 2016 -- and he thinks he can win here this year. Don’t let the GOP turn New Hampshire red. Join Team Shaheen →

Last night, at the New Hampshire Democratic Party's annual McIntyre-Shaheen 100 Club Dinner, thousands of Democrats gathered together. We're fired up, unified, and ready to win up and down the ballot this year.

We have just three days until New Hampshire’s first in the nation primary, and the energy in the air here is unlike anything else. Every four years, Granite Staters really put candidates through their paces. We see the candidates up close and challenge them to show us their plans for the future. And let's remember, despite some fierce debates, we agree on many important principles. We want to make sure people who need health care -- especially people with pre-existing conditions -- can afford it. We want to stop the misuse of opioids that are ravaging our communities. We want to raise wages for families and ensure women get equal pay for equal work. And we’re going to stop Wall Street from hitting consumers with surprise medical bills.   The Democratic candidates for president have run inspiring campaigns and have given America hope when we’ve needed it most. No matter what happens on Tuesday, all of us must come together in the urgent common purpose of defeating Donald Trump. The stakes have never been higher than this election -- and our democracy hangs in the balance. I’m sending my best wishes to the Democratic presidential candidates ahead of Tuesday’s primary, and I look forward to coming together afterward to unite and win.
Primary weekend is here! Pleased to welcome the crowd at tonight's Democratic debate at Saint Anselm College in Manchester.
Stefany, Stacey, and Molly here -- we're Jeanne's daughters. Today is our mom's birthday! Please help us make sure she has a great birthday by adding your greetings in the comments below.

Today marks 75 years since the liberation of Auschwitz. We remember the millions of Jews and other victims who lost their lives during the Holocaust -- and we recommit ourselves to confronting anti-Semitism in the U.S. and around the world. #HolocaustRemembranceDay #NeverAgain

It's time to reverse the flow of unlimited, undisclosed money we’ve seen infect our democracy over the last decade. I'm honored to receive an A on End Citizens United's scorecard and remain committed to fighting to return the power back to the voters.

The GOP is waging an all-out coordinated attack on reproductive rights in the states, in Congress, and in the courts. On the 47th anniversary of Roe v. Wade, I'm recommitting myself to the fight against any and all efforts to roll back our progress. Women's rights are non-negotiable.

10 years ago today, the Supreme Court's Citizens United decision unleashed a flood of money from wealthy corporations and special interest groups into our elections – leading to an explosion of dark money in politics like our country has never seen before. Add your name if you agree it's time to get big money out of politics and end Citizens United:

Today is the twentieth MLK Day in New Hampshire -- established in 1999 after a decades-long fight.  Thank you to the Hon. Jackie Weatherspoon for this reminder of how far we've come and how far we still have to go:

Today, I'm reflecting on the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. It's been 56 years since Dr. King gave his "I Have a Dream" speech from the steps of the Lincoln Memorial and nearly 55 years since the Selma to Montgomery marches. And this year marks the 20th anniversary of MLK Day in New Hampshire -- which I was honored to sign into law as NH Governor in 1999 alongside Martin Luther King III. As the years tick by, Dr. King's work and legacy remain just as important today as ever before. This MLK Day, we renew our commitment to his dream of justice and equality for all.
Bill O'Brien is the most anti-choice candidate in the GOP primary against Jeanne Shaheen. O'Brien would be an automatic vote for Supreme Court judges intent on overturning Roe v. Wade.

39 GOP Senators just took another strike at dismantling critical reproductive rights. We can't look away. We can't back down. Reproductive rights are at risk every single day - and it's up to us to protect our future.
Happy New Year! We have a lot of work to do together in 2020, and as always, I’m grateful for your support and partnership.
Rep. John Lewis is an American hero and one of the strongest fighters I've ever known. My thoughts are with him and his loved ones. Rep. Lewis, we are pulling and praying for you.

Time is running out before tonight's FEC end-of-quarter deadline - the most important of our campaign so far. We must win here if Democrats are going to take back the Senate, but Trump & the GOP are targeting NH to turn red. Fight back and chip in now: https://bit.ly/2SGnLQE
Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays from the Shaheen family! Wishing you and yours joy and peace this holiday season. (Photo credit: Chris Scott)
Sending warm wishes to all those celebrating Hanukkah -- chag sameach!

When treatment providers have flexibility in using resources to combat the full scope of substance abuse, more people get the help they need.  I'm pleased the bipartisan government funding bill includes my legislation on this critical issue:
This is a step in the right direction for NH residents looking for more information and transparency around PFAS contamination -- and I'm ready to keep up the fight.
Investing in our infrastructure doesn't only mean roads, bridges, and waterways. It also means ensuring access to high-quality broadband services -- especially in rural communities that need it most.
There's just one more day to get covered for 2020! Be sure to visit HealthCare.gov today and find the health care plan that works for you and your family before open enrollment ends tomorrow.

Granite Staters deserve answers about the health impacts of PFAS exposure. I'm pleased this study is moving forward, and I'll continue to be a partner in the effort to demand action and accountability.
Happy Thanksgiving from the Shaheen family!  (Photo credit: Stefany)
About a third of women veterans experience intimate partner violence at some point in their lifetime. We need to take immediate steps to improve support services -- help should never be out of reach.

The Trump administration continues to put Americans' health at risk by promoting junk insurance plans -- which can lack coverage for pre-existing conditions, mental health or prescription drugs. We must keep fighting their attempts to sabotage our care.

It was wonderful to be at the Portsmouth Naval Shipyard on Friday to break ground on two major projects that will modernize and optimize the facility. Securing and protecting resources for the shipyard will continue to be a top priority for me.

Survivors of sexual assault must be treated with dignity, have access to essential services, and be able to pursue justice. That's why I wrote the federal Survivors’ Bill of Rights Act, which was signed into law in 2016 -- and that's why now I'm working to expand protections for survivors on the state level.

Ensuring our veterans have access to high-quality care and job opportunities will always be a top priority of mine. Veterans and their families make huge sacrifices to protect us, and we must honor our commitment to them. I'm honored to have folks like Jim in my corner:

This Veterans Day, we thank the brave Americans who have served and who continue to serve our country -- who put their lives on the line to defend our freedom.  We must always ensure that they and their families receive the support and care they deserve.
I'm not going to let them bring us back to a time when men made women's health care decisions.

Election Day 2020 is one year from today.  We can win this race in New Hampshire and take back the U.S. Senate for Democrats - but only with your help. Like and share if you’re with us.U.S. Deficits are Grossly Understated:
Great to be in Laconia and Manchester this morning with fired up Democrats ready to get out the vote!  Election Day is this Tuesday - make sure you have a plan to vote.
Today is the first day of ACA open enrollment. Go to healthcare.gov to explore the high-quality, affordable health care coverage options for you and your family, and #GetCovered today.

I'm proud to support Joyce Craig's re-election campaign for mayor of Manchester. I know Joyce will continue to deliver real results in her second term. But she can't win this race without our help. Sign up here to get out the vote this weekend: https://bit.ly/2Ntc0J1We work better when we work together, and Jeanne Shaheen has played an important role in the progress we’ve made in Manchester in the past two years. I’m honored to have her support, and I look forward to continue working with her to continue building a stronger Manchester.

Surprise medical bills can cost patients thousands of dollars and quickly put families' budgets in the red. I've been working to stop this practice -- but a dark money group has spent millions to deter my efforts, confuse voters, and put profits ahead of people. They won’t intimidate me. I'll always put New Hampshire first, and I'll keep working across the aisle to stop surprise medical billing.Here’s how a dark money group spent $30 million to stop Congress from ending ‘surprising medical bills’
Happy to be at tonight’s New Hampshire Democratic Party Eleanor Roosevelt Dinner with hundreds of fellow Democrats!

Voting is essential to our democracy. One of my GOP opponents has worked to suppress young people's votes, claiming they are "foolish," "don't have life experience," and "vote their feelings." If you agree that's wrong, sign on: https://bit.ly/31JXB0r

When I first ran for governor, there was only one other woman governor in the country. Now, I'm one of 25 women in the U.S. Senate. We've made progress, but we still have a long way to go before reaching parity.  We need more women in office at all levels -- because when we elect women, we all do better.

Combating PFAS contamination is an important priority here in NH and in communities across the country. No one should be forced to question the safety of their drinking water or be exposed to potentially harmful chemicals like these while doing their jobs. I have led efforts in Congress to uncover the potential health impacts of PFAS in our water supply by authoring and securing funding for the first-ever national health study on this issue -- which I’m pleased to report is now underway.  I won’t stop fighting until we get the Granite State families impacted by PFAS the answers they deserve.
New Hampshire’s 116 breweries make important contributions to our state’s economy. I’m proud to help Granite State brewers grow their businesses and expand their workforces 🍻
50 years ago today. Happy anniversary, Billy!

Protecting reproductive rights and access to health care has always been a top priority of mine -- and that's never been more critical than in this era of GOP leaders' attacks on our rights. I'm honored to earn Planned Parenthood Action's endorsement.

Tomorrow is the special election in Epping! We have the opportunity to flip this seat and elect Naomi Andrews for State Representative. An Epping native, Naomi is advocating for quality public education, fighting for clean air and water, and combating the opioid crisis. She will be a strong leader for the people of Epping, and I’m thrilled to be supporting her campaign. This will be a tight race, so if you're a voter in Epping, be sure to head to the polls at Epping Middle School Gym (21 Academy Street) between 8 a.m. and 7 p.m. and vote for Naomi!

Today, the Supreme Court announced it will take up a case on abortion restrictions. This is just the latest in a concerted effort to overturn Roe v. Wade and to deny people across the country access to critical reproductive health care. Our rights are at risk, and we must fight this with everything we've got.

We must win this race if Democrats are going to retake the Senate -- but GOP outside groups have spent more against me than all the other in-cycle Democratic senators COMBINED.  Help me fight back. Chip in before tonight's end-of-quarter deadline:
Today is National Voter Registration Day! There's no better way to make your voice heard. Take a moment to make sure you're registered to vote -- and check in with family and friends too:

Donald Trump is personally recruiting Corey Lewandowski to run for U.S. Senate in New Hampshire, and a new SuperPAC is ready to spend millions to help him win. We need to be ready to fight back. Chip in now and join our team:

Manchester Mayor Joyce Craig is an outstanding leader who's making critical progress strengthening our schools and growing our local economy. Make sure Joyce can keep building a stronger Manchester by voting TODAY in the municipal primary election. Polls are open from 6am to 7pm. Find your polling location here: http://joycecraig.org/vote

The Violence Against Women Act has helped protect survivors of domestic and sexual violence since it first became law 25 years ago today. The House reauthorized VAWA in April. It's time for Mitch McConnell to do his job and bring this bill up for a vote in the Senate now.

Today, we remember the nearly 3,000 innocent men, women, and children we lost on September 11, 2001 - including 10 Granite Staters.  We'll never forget the first responders who ran toward danger to save others and the tremendous selflessness and sacrifice made by so many.

I just addressed thousands of fellow Democrats at this year's New Hampshire Democratic Party State Convention. What amazing energy -- Granite Staters are fired up and ready to elect Democrats up and down the ticket!

I'm speaking at today's New Hampshire Democratic Party State Convention in just a few minutes. Be sure to tune in!The 2019 New Hampshire Democratic Party State Convention is on track to be our biggest event ever, and we'll be streaming it live on Facebook starting at 9:30am! If you're unable to attend, you can tune in here.  Get ready to hear from 19 of the 2020 Democratic presidential candidates, our wonderful NH senators, representatives, state legislative leaders, executive councilors, and mayors, and national labor leaders and DNC chair Tom Perez; and see how fired up New Hampshire Dems are to elect Democrats up and down the ballot in 2020!

Every day in the U.S. Senate, I’m working to strengthen our economy, create good-paying jobs, and stand up for hard-working Granite Staters and their families. That's why I'm thrilled the New Hampshire AFL-CIO has endorsed my campaign for re-election to the U.S. Senate. We have a lot of work still ahead of us -- and I'm so proud to stand alongside New Hampshire's working men and women to keep fighting for progress.

I’m fighting to reform our broken campaign finance system and put an end to the dark money and special interests corrupting our democracy. I’m honored to be endorsed by End Citizens United today -- and I won't stop fighting until our government works for the people.

Today is Women's Equality Day, marking 99 years since the certification of the 19th Amendment -- an important milestone in the fight for full equality. Yet today is also a reminder that there is still much work to be done to achieve freedom and equality for all. We're fighting to ensure women can make their own health care decisions, to guarantee equal pay for equal work, and to grow female representation in leadership and decision-making roles. We must all keep raising our voices to fight for progress.

I stand with Planned Parenthood and the millions of people, including thousands of Granite Staters, they provide care for. The Trump administration's gag rule jeopardizes access to preventative services like cancer screenings and yearly physical exams. We must keep fighting to protect Title X and block the gag rule so that patients don’t lose vital health care.

Donald Trump just stepped off the stage at his Manchester rally. He made it clear that the GOP is targeting New Hampshire's Senate seat in 2020. We know Trump and his allies will spend millions to try to defeat me. We need to be ready to fight back, and we can’t do it without you. Chip in $5 and join our team:

Donald Trump is coming to New Hampshire for a rally today. He lost NH by half a percentage point in 2016 -- and he thinks he can win here in 2020. Don’t let the GOP turn New Hampshire red. Join Team Shaheen → https://bit.ly/2TAhNzp
New Hampshire’s fire fighters have always been part of the Shaheen family. Honored to have the Professional Fire Fighters of New Hampshire's earliest ever endorsement for Senate.

I'm honored to be endorsed today by the Professional Fire Fighters of New Hampshire -- their earliest endorsement for Senate in history.  Throughout my time in the U.S. Senate, I have advocated for legislation and resources that will strengthen our fire departments and help them keep our state safe. This includes expanding SAFER grants that support our local fire departments, supporting reauthorization of the 9/11 Victim Compensation Fund, and fighting the opioid epidemic -- which fire fighters are on the front lines in combatting. Fire fighters are pillars of communities across New Hampshire. I couldn't be more proud to have the PFFNH's support and look forward to our continued work together.
This is a must-win race if Democrats are going to take back the U.S. Senate next year – and we need to grow our team to take on whomever the GOP nominates. Will you join us? https://bit.ly/2ywFAGL
Democracy is stronger when more Americans participate in it. We should be encouraging young people to vote, not telling them that their voices and their votes are not valued.

We're just a couple weeks away from one of the best events of the year - our annual Harbor Cruise in Portsmouth! We can't wait to see you there on Wednesday, August 7 at 6:30pm. Grab your tickets here: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/harborcruise19
What a beautiful night for the Pelham Democrats’ annual BBQ. Thank you for having me, and for everything you all are doing to gear up for 2020!

The streets of Portsmouth are filled with friends and family celebrating our LGBTQ community for Pride. There’s so much more to do to ensure equality for everyone, but days like today remind us how far we’ve come. 🏳️‍🌈
Manchester is in good hands with Joyce Craig, and the whole city is excited to knock on doors and re-elect her in November. My choice is Joyce!
Grateful for the leadership of Senator Melanie Levesque, who led efforts to establish Juneteenth as a holiday in New Hampshire. Thank you, Melanie. Your advocacy makes us stronger.

Emancipation ended one of the worst periods in American history but, unfortunately, communities of color continue to face extreme barriers and inequality. Let's celebrate #Juneteenth, but we must also work together to create a stronger future for everyone.
So wonderful to see the Pride flag flying above Manchester. Grateful to have a leader like Joyce Craig who celebrates every member of our LGBT community.

#TBT to 20 years ago when I signed into law Martin Luther King Jr. Day, ending New Hampshire's status as the only state not to recognize his birthday as an official holiday.  MLK's legacy inspired millions, and continues to fuel our fight for justice today.

Ending gerrymandering is about making our democracy stronger. We should all agree on that, regardless of political party. Great to see Eric Holder and Arnold Schwarzenegger coming together and applauding the bipartisan efforts in New Hampshire's legislature to end partisan gerrymandering. This is spot on - let's give the power back to the people.
Love is love, always, and it’s wonderful to see so many joyful celebrations of our LGBTQ+ community during Pride Month in New Hampshire. Happy Pride to all!
I repealed an anti-LGBT law that banned same-sex adoption as Governor in 1999, and we should not let the President turn back the clock now. This is absolutely shameful.

This is so wrong. To deny Harriet Tubman's legacy hurts our entire nation, and especially people of color and women. I'll keep pushing for Harriet Tubman on the $20, no matter the Trump administration's petty obstruction.

We're not going to let them bring us back to the days when men controlled women's health care decisions. Roe vs. Wade is the law of the land, and we need to fight to protect it.  Join tomorrow's rally in Concord to Stop The Bans. Link here:
Thank you to our firefighters for keeping New Hampshire safe. Grateful for your leadership on International Firefighters’ Day, and every day.
Nashua has a strong leader in Mayor Jim Donchess. The energy around his campaign is proof the people of Nashua are with him.
Wishing a very happy Easter to all of my friends in the Greek-American community. Christos Anesti!
So excited to have Joyce Craig kick off her re-election campaign! Joyce has been an incredible leader as Mayor of Manchester, and the Queen City is fired up and ready for her second term.

Tens of thousands of young people could lose the right to vote because of a new voter suppression law in New Hampshire. I'm asking every presidential candidate to sign this petition to protect the right to vote.  Will you stand up for voting rights too?

I am asking every Presidential candidate to stand up for the tens of thousands of young Granite Staters who could lose the right to vote because of a new voter suppression law in New Hampshire. Let's send a message to anyone seeking to subvert voting rights.

Voter rights are under attack in New Hampshire. Tens of thousands of young people could be disenfranchised by photo ID requirements and arbitrary challenges to residency. Tomorrow I'm asking every candidate for President to publicly denounce this voter suppression law.
President Trump’s transgender military ban is a stain on our nation. These students want to serve our country, and they are some of the bravest people in America. This is so wrong.
‪This is great news, we need more women in all levels of government. Also, where can I buy a pair of those awesome socks?
My friend Joyce Craig has been a tremendous leader for Manchester. I am excited to see all she will accomplish for the Queen City during her second term!

It's 2019. How are we still debating whether women deserve the same pay as men? I'm pushing for Equal Pay because my daughters and granddaughters should not have to fight to be compensated fairly for their work.

‪Congratulations to the new officers of the New Hampshire Young Democrats! The NH Young Dems are energizing Granite Staters in every community, and I'm excited to keep working together to deliver for our state.‬‪📸the fierce, talented, and passionate new officers of the New Hampshire Young Democrats.‬ ‪The bar is high so thank you for stepping-up lead our organization for the next two years👏 😁‬ ‪Now let’s get to work. #nhpolitics‬
This rings incredibly hollow from an administration looking to strike down the entire Affordable Care Act. We'll keep fighting in Congress to stop their health care sabotage.
Release the report. America deserves to see it.

Tonight's the night! Can't wait to see everyone at the Puritan Backroom tonight for our Snowflake reception. Final opportunity to RSVP here: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/snowflake19?fbclid=IwAR1leWngBvePOhff_7kGSC7xMEPu0kCZBYOoMFI_M4-afdEQZBFMF5KEvHw.Tomorrow is the big day - our 8th annual Snowflake reception! Can't wait to see you all there at the Puritan Backroom. If you still need a ticket - grab one here: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/snowflake19.
